abstract: British court that oversees country's intelligence services rules that mass collection of cellphone and online records before December 2014 was illegal; privacy advocates count ruling as victory, but some experts warn that decision will not stop collection of data.
lead_paragraph: The ruling, the first of its kind against the British intelligence services, relates to data that was shared with the United States National Security Agency.

headline.main: British Court Says Spying on Data Was Illegal
headline.print_headline: British Court Says Spying on Data Was Illegal

snippet: The ruling, the first of its kind against the British intelligence services, relates to data that was shared with the United States National Security Agency.
